body: Agreed. There are a few more, reported on twitter. I haven't had a chance to tackle them :( but I will soon if no one else takes them on :)

I think i found the bug. There is two colon (::) before the code-block. May i make a PR?
Also, the suitable lexer for .htaccess code is this http://pygments.org/docs/lexers/#pygments.lexers.configs.ApacheConfLexer

> Agreed. There are a few more, reported on twitter

@jim-parry which are the other? I tried to search other code-block but those seems ok.

Removing the double colon at the end of line 45 eliminates the sphinx error, and the htaccess block is formatted correctly, but grayed.

Also changing the directive, from "console" to "apache" appears to be the correct choice, with the htaccess directive color-coded.

@mamat-rahmat Thank you, and yes, go for a PR :)

ps - the other errors reported on twitter seem to have been fixed with recent changes, although there are still a number of Sphinx hiccups in the CodeIgniter4 user guide.

issue.title: Fix broken .htaccess example code-block

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
- remove double colon before code-block
- change lexer into apacheconf

Fixes #5283

Signed-off-by: Mamat Rahmat <coderbodoh@gmail.com>

body: While it's fixed; the error is still present on the [documentation](https://www.codeigniter.com/user_guide/general/urls.html?highlight=apache#removing-the-index-php-file).
Yea, docs are in the same repo as the actual code and the fix was commited after the last release and, so ...
I see, the docs will get some love with the next release :)

issue.title: User Guide Removing the Index.php Codeblock not rendering correctly.

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body: In the User Guide under General, URLs the Removing the index.php file section found [here](https://www.codeigniter.com/user_guide/general/urls.html#removing-the-index-php-file) has a codeblock which is incorrectly rendered. Instead of reading as: > If your Apache server has mod_rewrite enabled, you can easily remove this file by using a .htaccess file with some simple rules. Here is an example of such a file, using the negative method in which everything is redirected except the specified items: ```RewriteEngine On RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d RewriteRule ^(.*)$ index.php/$1 [L] ``` > In the above example, any HTTP request other than those for existing directories and existing files is treated as a request for your index.php file. It instead reads as: > If your Apache server has mod_rewrite enabled, you can easily remove this file by using a .htaccess file with some simple rules. Here is an example of such a file, using the negative method in which everything is redirected except the specified items: `.. code-block:: console` > > RewriteEngine On RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d RewriteRule ^(.*)$ index.php/$1 [L] > In the above example, any HTTP request other than those for existing directories and existing files is treated as a request for your index.php file. I have placed a comment [here](https://github.com/bcit-ci/CodeIgniter/commit/ea21f113733e914d5d0c950d5bfb5c5624368407#commitcomment-26627281) on the original commit, which contains more details.
